tasks.title: Fix Hardcoded Date Locale in Yield History
tasks.description: Date formatting uses hardcoded 'en-US' locale: new Date(dateString).toLocaleDateString('en-US', {...}). This should use the user's preferred locale from i18n settings. Implement consistent date formatting using date-fns with locale support.

changes.details: Create composable that provides formatDate(), formatDateTime(), formatDateRange() functions. Use date-fns format() with locale from i18n. Import locales: import { enUS, hi, bn, te, mr, kn } from 'date-fns/locale'. Map language codes to date-fns locales.
Replace toLocaleDateString('en-US', ...) with formatDate() from useDateFormat composable. Import: const { formatDate } = useDateFormat()
Export current locale reactively so useDateFormat can access it

acceptanceCriteria: Date formatting respects user's selected language/locale
Dates display in local format when Hindi is selected (e.g., '6 फ़रवरी 2026')
Dates display in local format when Bengali is selected
useDateFormat composable is reusable across all modules
No hardcoded 'en-US' locale strings in yield pages

testScenarios.expectedResult: Dates show Hindi month names and localized format (e.g., '6 फ़रवरी 2026')
Dates show English format (e.g., 'February 6, 2026')
